raw_text:
Irish finish with home game
 
 Republic of Ireland manager Brian Kerr has been granted his wish for a home game as the final World Cup qualifier.
 
 Ireland will close their bid to reach the 2006 finals by playing Switzerland in Dublin on 12 October 2005. The Republic met the Swiss in their final Euro 2004 qualifier, losing 2-0 away and missing out on a place in the finals in Portugal. The Group Four fixtures were hammered out at a meeting in Dublin on Tuesday. The Irish open their campaign on 4 September at home to Cyprus and wrap up the 10-match series on 12 October 2005, with the visit of Switzerland. Manager Brian Kerr and FAI officials met representatives from Switzerland, France, Cyprus, Israel and the Faroe Islands to arrange the fixture schedule. Kerr had hoped to finish with a clash against France, but got the reigning European champions as their penultimate home match on 7 September 2005. The manager got his wish to avoid a repeat of finishing their bid to qualify with too many away matches.
 
 Republic of Ireland v Cyprus; France v Israel; Switzerland v Faroe Islands.
 
 Switzerland v Republic of Ireland; Israel v Cyprus; Faroe Islands v France.
 
 France v Republic of Ireland; Israel v Switzerland; Cyprus v Faroe Islands.
 
 Republic of Ireland v Faroe Islands; Cyprus v France.
 
 Cyprus v Israel.
 
 France v Switzerland; Israel v Republic of Ireland.
 
 Switzerland v Cyprus; Israel v France.
 
 Republic of Ireland v Israel; Faroe Islands v Switzerland.
 
 Faroe Islands v Republic of Ireland. August 17 - Faroe Islands v Cyprus.
 
 France v Faroe Islands; Switzerland v Israel.
 
 Republic of Ireland v France; Cyprus v Switzerland; Faroe Islands v Israel.
 
 Switzerland v France; Israel v Faroe Islands; Cyprus v Republic of Ireland.
 
 France v Cyprus; Republic of Ireland v Switzerland.
llama3.2:1b: Ireland's final World Cup qualifier will be played at home against Switzerland on October 12, 2005, as part of a group stage fixture schedule.
The draw was arranged by manager Brian Kerr and FAI officials after meeting with representatives from other teams.
llama3.2:3b: Republic of Ireland to play Switzerland in final World Cup qualifier, scheduled for October 12, 2005, at home in Dublin.
This match follows a series of fixtures against other teams in the group.
Manager Brian Kerr had hoped to avoid playing away matches later in the campaign.
The Republic will open their bid on September 4 against Cyprus and conclude with the match against Switzerland.
gemma2:2b: Ireland will play Switzerland for their final World Cup qualifier on October 12, 2005 in Dublin.
The group schedule includes home games against Cyprus and then France, with the possibility to avoid an extended series of away matches.
The schedule is a combination of home and away games over ten matches, ultimately leading them toward the 2006 World Cup finals.
qwen2.5:0.5b: The Irish will play their final World Cup qualifier match against Switzerland on 12 October 2005 in Dublin, as the host nation for Euro 2006 qualifiers.

The other matches are:

- Cyprus vs Ireland (August 17)
- France vs Israel (September)
- Switzerland vs Faroe Islands (October)

The Republic of Ireland won their home match against Cyprus in Dublin on September 4, 2005.
They had to play away at home but managed to avoid a repeat of the previous year's situation by avoiding too many away games.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Irish manager Brian Kerr secures a home game, including a clash against Switzerland on October 12, 2005, to secure their spot in the 2006 World Cup finals.

The final fixtures are: Republic of Ireland vs Cyprus; France vs Israel; Switzerland vs Faroe Islands; France vs Republic of Ireland; Israel vs Switzerland; Cyprus vs Faroe Islands; Republic of Ireland vs Faroe Islands; Cyprus vs France; France vs Israel; Switzerland vs Cyprus; Israel vs France.
qwen2.5:3b: Irish manager Brian Kerr secured a home game for their final World Cup qualifier, with Ireland playing Switzerland in Dublin on 12 October 2005.
This will be the last match before closing their qualification campaign against Cyprus (home) and Switzerland (away).
The fixture schedule was determined at a meeting involving representatives from Republic of Ireland, Switzerland, France, Cyprus, Israel, and Faroe Islands.
Kerr had hoped to finish with a home game against France but settled for playing Switzerland in Dublin.

Teams were grouped into matches: Switzerland vs Faroe Islands; Israel vs Cyprus; France vs Ireland (home); Israel vs France (away); Cyprus vs Iran (Faroe Islands); Republic of Ireland vs Israel (away).
The final fixture will be between the top two teams.

Irish finish with home game
Republic of Ireland manager Brian Kerr has been granted his wish for a home game as the final World Cup qualifier.
The Ireland will close their bid to reach the 2006 finals by playing Switzerland in Dublin on 12 October 2005.
The Republic met the Swiss in their final Euro 2004 qualifier, losing 2-0 away and missing out on a place in the finals in Portugal.
The Group Four fixtures were hammered out at a meeting in Dublin on Tuesday.
The Irish open their campaign on 4 September at home to Cyprus and wrap up the 10-match series on 12 October 2005.
Manager Brian Kerr and FAI officials met representatives from Switzerland, France, Cyprus, Israel, and the Faroe Islands to arrange the fixture schedule.
Kerr had hoped to finish with a clash against France, but got the reigning European champions as their penultimate home match on 7 September 2005.
The manager got his wish to avoid a repeat of finishing their bid to qualify with too many away matches.
